III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior Management
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A alleges Staff person 1 and Staff person 2’s actions
caused him to bump his forehead on the van.
Investigation Complainant
I spoke with Complainant on 06/09/2023 by phone. Complainant
stated Youth A reported he hit his head on 06/08/2023 when Staff
person 1 and Supervisor 1 got him out of the van. Complainant
stated he took Youth A to the local urgent care and spoke with the
doctor. Complainant stated the doctor reported Youth A’s
forehead injury was not significant.
Youth A
I attempted to interview Youth A on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine
Center with another Department of Health and Human Service
worker. Youth A refused the interview and stormed out of the
cafeteria after I introduced myself. I did not observe any mark or
swelling on Youth A’s forehead.
Two Department of Health and Human Service workers met with
Youth A on 06/08/2023 around 6:30 pm. The following is an
account of their interview with Youth A. Youth A stated he was
irritated at school and left and sat in the driver seat of the
unlocked Wolverine Center van. Youth A told Staff person 1 and
Supervisor 1 he was relaxing when they directed him to get out of
the van. Youth A stated Staff person 1 and Supervisor 1 pulled
him out of the van causing him to hit his head on the van. Youth A
stated he walked back to Wolverine Center, went to the hospital
for his forehead bump and returned to Wolverine Center.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker. Youth
B stated he walked out to the school parking lot and saw Youth A
sitting in the driver seat of the van with the door open honking the
horn and hitting the inside of the van. Youth B stated Supervisor 1
2

grabbed Youth A’s left arm and redirected Youth A to get out of
the van or he would be removed from the van. Youth B stated
Staff person 1 secured Youth A’s right arm and Youth A got out of
the van and hit his head on the upper door frame of the car. Youth
B stated Youth A said, “I hit my head” and tried to get back in the
van. Youth B stated Staff person 1 secured Youth A’s arms when
Youth A tried to hit Supervisor 1. Youth B stated Youth A truanted
when Staff person 1 released his hold.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine Center
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Staff person 1 stated Supervisor 1 brought Youth A to school after
lunch. Staff person 1 stated Youth A began to cut his shorts with a
pair of scissors instead of working on the project. Staff person 1
stated the teacher retrieved the scissors from Youth A and Youth
A wanted to return to Wolverine Center. Staff person 1 stated
Supervisor 1 followed Youth A out of the classroom. Staff person
1 stated Youth A blocked the exit door and banged his head
against the window panel next to the door. Staff person 1 stated
Youth A exited the building and Supervisor 1 followed him. Staff
person 1 stated he heard a van horn and Supervisor 1 calling
Youth A’s name and went outside to assist. Staff person 1 stated
Youth A was in the van driver seat with the door closed. Staff
person 1 stated he redirected Youth A to step out of the van and
he put his arm in the van when Youth A tried to put on the
seatbelt. Staff person 1 stated Youth A got out of the van on his
own with his fists balled up. Staff person 1 stated he and
Supervisor 1 placed Youth A in a two-person standing hold for
approximately ten seconds and let go of Youth A when he pulled
towards the ground. Staff person 1 stated Youth A got up and
walked away and Supervisor 1 followed Youth A. Staff person 1
stated he went back inside the school building. Staff person 1
stated he did not see Youth A hit his head on the van.
Supervisor 1
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 06/13/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Supervisor 1 stated she drove Youth A to school and he became
irate in class using a pair of scissors to cut up his shorts.
Supervisor 1 stated she secured the scissors from Youth A and
returned the scissors to the teacher. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
left the classroom and when he got to the exit door, he put his foot
against the door and banged his head against the window next to
the door. Supervisor 1 stated she redirected Youth A and followed
him outside. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A got in the driver seat of
3

the van leaving the van door open. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
honked the horn repeatedly and Staff person 1 came out and
redirected Youth A to get out of the van. Supervisor 1 stated she
reached into the van to unfasten the seatbelt off Youth A.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A then got out of the van kicking
towards Staff person 1. Supervisor 1 stated she and Staff person
1 placed Youth A in a two-person standing hold until Youth A used
his weight to drop to the ground and released. Supervisor 1 stated
Youth A got up and walked back to Wolverine Center while she
drove the van slowly down the street following him. Supervisor 1
stated Youth A told Complainant that he bumped his head.
Supervisor 1 stated she did not pull Youth A out of the van and did
not see Youth A hit his head on the van’s door frame.
Photograph
Two Department of Health and Human Service workers met with
Youth A on 06/08/2023 at 6:30 pm and took a picture of Youth A’s
forehead. The picture shows a faint, horizontal like red mark on
the left side of his forehead between his left eyebrow and left side
forehead hairline.
Incident report
Staff person 1 and Supervisor 2 wrote incident reports dated
06/08/2023. Incident reports match their respective interviews.
Urgent Care
Youth A was seen at Michigan Urgent Care on 06/08/2023 at 4:20
pm. Youth A’s discharge paperwork states he was assessed for a
head injury and diagnosed with a forehead contusion.
Personnel Files
Staff person 1 was hired on 03/16/2020. His last restraint training
was completed on 03/07/2023. Staff person 1 was disciplined in
04/2022 for a driving issue.
Supervisor 1 was hired on 05/02/2023. She completed restraint
training on 05/16/2023. Supervisor 1 does not have a discipline
history.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
completed an investigation without findings.
Analysis Youth A told Complainant and two Department of Health and
Human Service workers that Staff person 1 and Supervisor 1
caused him to bump his head on 06/08/2023 when they took him
out of the van. Youth B stated seeing Staff person 1 and
Supervisor 1 take Youth A out of the van and hearing Youth A
4

say, “I hit my head.” Staff person 1 and Supervisor 1 deny pulling
Youth A out of the van and stated Youth A got out of the van on
his own. Staff person 1 and Supervisor 1 stated Youth A banged
his head against the window next to the school exit door before he
headed out to the parking lot. Youth A was diagnosed with a
forehead contusion on 06/08/2023 by a doctor. It cannot be
determined conclusively if Youth A’s forehead contusion is self-
inflicted from banging his head on a window next to the school exit
door or occurred when he exited the van.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
